body.p: What would your conclusions be if the dean of students suspected that the mean number of alcoholic drinks that students in the college consume in a typical week is lower than the mean of U.S. college students in general? In other words, if this were a test of the hypotheses:

part.hint: Consider how a one-sided versus a two-sided test affects the p-value.

alternative.title: R
alternative.p: In this case, we would test:

The p-value for this test would be 0.072/2 = 0.036 (half that of the two-sided test). At the 0.05 significance level we would therefore reject H0 and conclude that the data provide evidence that the mean number of alcoholic drinks that students in the college consume in a typical week is indeed lower than the mean of U.S. college students in general (as the dean suspected).
